questions.question: Who wrote the story, "The King of Mazy May"?

choices.answer: Jack Londan
John London
Jack London
John Landon

questions.question: Where does "The King of Mazy May" take place?

choices.answer: in the Klondike
in California
in Europe
in South America

questions.question: When does "The King of Mazy May" take place?

choices.answer: during the California Gold Rush
during the Klondike Gold Rush
during the Civil War
after World War II

questions.question: In "The King of Mazy May," why has Walt never seen a train or an elevator?

choices.answer: These machines have not yet been invented.
He prefers to stay away from cities.
He does not want anything to do with machines.
He lives in an area without these machines.

questions.question: In "The King of Mazy May," why does Walt dislike claim-jumpers?

choices.answer: They think about nothing but getting rich.
They steal land and riches from others.
They have bad tempers.
They treat their dogs very badly.

questions.question: In "The King of Mazy May," what is the main reason that the claim-jumpers chase Walt?

choices.answer: They are angry that he has been spying on them.
They want to find out what he knows.
They want to make sure he does not get to Dawson first.
They want their dogs and sled back.

questions.question: What is the most important reason that Walt needs a strong lead dog for his trip?

choices.answer: A strong lead dog can carry more weight than the other dogs.
They can smell the claim-jumpers as they get closer.
A strong lead dog knows how to run on ice and snow.
They can follow commands and choose the best trail.

questions.question: In "The King of Mazy May," why is Walt so determined to get to Dawson before the claim-jumpers?

choices.answer: to reunite with his father
to warn everyone about the claim-jumpers
to register Loren’s claim before the claim-jumpers do
to find more wealth in a different creek

questions.question: In "The King of Mazy May," why do the claim-jumpers keep shooting at Walt?

choices.answer: They are desperate to stop him in his tracks.
They are trying to defend themselves against whip attacks.
They think he is carrying gold.
Walt challenged them to a race from Mazy May to Dawson.

questions.question: Which word BEST describes Walt’s character in "The King of Mazy May"?

choices.answer: angry
timid
rebellious
resourceful

questions.question: How does the creek in the setting of "The King of Mazy May" contribute to the story?

choices.answer: Gold is found there. Walt follows the creek on his journey.
The claim-jumpers finally drown in the creek.
Walt paddles down the creek to get to Dawson.
The creek floods, putting the prospectors in danger.

questions.question: Near the end of the chase, how does Walt finally stop the claim-jumpers from gaining on him?

choices.answer: He runs beside the sled to help his dogs pull harder/faster.
He attacks the men with his whip and trips their lead dog.
He uses his knowledge of the creek to outwit them.
He keeps up a fast pace to wear out the men’s dog team.
